abstract: Pro-Ukrainian protester Roman Torgovitsky mounts Metropolitan Opera Stage to criticize soprano Anna Netrebko and conductor Valery Gergiev for their support of Russian Pres Vladimir Putin; says from a holding pen in Manhattan that he has done same at performance by Russian violinist Vladimir Spivakov at Harvard's Sanders Theater; he will likely be arraigned on charges of criminal trespass.
lead_paragraph: The man who leapt onto the stage during the Metropolitan Opera’s “Iolanta” to protest Russian actions in Ukraine had done something similar at a Russian violinist’s performance at Harvard.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

snippet: The man who leapt onto the stage during the Metropolitan Opera’s “Iolanta” to protest Russian actions in Ukraine had done something similar at a Russian violinist’s performance at Harvard.

headline.main: Incursion Wasn’t a First for a Protester
headline.print_headline: Incursion Wasn’t a First for a Protester
